result.execSummary:
The defendant Everett D. Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT to 14CF1339 and Lake County, IL case 14CF1585.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not have contact with Rayshaun or Marquis J, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  DE appeared (by phone from St. Croix Correctional) without counsel.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  DE stipulates to and court orders restitution of $955.31, jointly and severally with Marquis Jones 14CF730 and Rayshaun Jones 14CF731.
With Deanna/St Croix Correctional Center a phone appearance is arranged for the deft for the TC on 10/12/17 at 1:30pm.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State in victim compliance.  Court imposes a total sentence of 9 years WSP concurrent with 14CF1339 and Lake County IL case 14CF1585; 5 years initial confinement w/credit for 178 days served; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; pay $250 DNA surcharge; court costs are waived w/exception of DNA surcharge.
With Atty Perz and ADA McNeill the SEH of 5/28/15 at 3pm is rescheduled, as DOC does not have sufficient time to prepare PSI; reset to 6/4/15 at 3:30pm.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  Deft to submit DNA sample.  SEH 5/28/15 at 3pm.  Bond continued.  Court extends detainer holding deft to complete sentencing, by stipulation of deft.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case may be resolved.  PLEAH set for 4/22/15 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.

Information filed, plea of not guilty. Status conference on 2-5-15 @ 8:15. Jury selection on 4-27-15 @ 9:00am. Jury trial on 4-28-15 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.
